Training Orchestration (admet.train)¶

The admet.train package handles the training loop. It supports both local execution and distributed training via Ray, managing dataset loading, model initialization, and artifact persistence.

Training¶

Training orchestration and trainer implementations.

class admet.train.BaseModelTrainer(model_cls, *, model_params=None, seed=None, n_fingerprint_bits=None, device=None, mixed_precision=False)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for single-dataset training orchestration.

Concrete implementations (e.g. XGBoostTrainer) supply backend‑specific logic for feature/target extraction, model construction, metrics, and artifact persistence. The run() method (implemented here) performs the end‑to‑end train‑evaluate‑save cycle.

Parameters:

  • model_cls (Type[ModelProtocol])

  • model_params (Optional[Dict[str, Any]])

  • seed (Optional[int])

  • n_fingerprint_bits (Optional[int])

  • device (Optional[str])

  • mixed_precision (bool)

model_cls

The model class (subclass of admet.model.base.BaseModel) used to construct the backend model.

Type:

type

model_params

Backend-specific hyperparameters passed to the model upon instantiation.

Type:

dict

seed

Random seed for deterministic training.

Type:

int or None

device

Device selection (e.g., 'cpu' or 'cuda') used by backends that execute on accelerators.

Type:

str or None

mixed_precision

Whether to use mixed-precision training for accelerated backends.

Type:

bool

abstract build_model(endpoints)[source]

Instantiate the backend model with endpoints and configuration.

Parameters:

endpoints (list of str) – Endpoints the model should predict.

Returns:

The instantiated model ready to be fit.

Return type:

BaseModel

abstract build_sample_weights(dataset, sample_weight_mapping)[source]

Construct a 1D sample weight array for the training split.

Parameters:

  • dataset (LoadedDataset) – Dataset used to extract sample identifiers from the training split.

  • sample_weight_mapping (dict, optional) – Mapping of dataset names to weights with optional default.

Returns:

1-D array of sample weights aligned with the training split or None when not applicable.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray or None

abstract compute_metrics(Y_train, Y_val, Y_test, pred_train, pred_val, pred_test, mask_train, mask_val, mask_test, endpoints)[source]

Compute all metrics for the provided true and predicted values.

Parameters:

  • Y_train (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • Y_val (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • Y_test (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • pred_train (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted values for each split.

  • pred_val (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted values for each split.

  • pred_test (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted values for each split.

  • mask_train (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating present/absent values for each target.

  • mask_val (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating present/absent values for each target.

  • mask_test (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating present/absent values for each target.

  • endpoints (list of str) – Endpoint names corresponding to target columns.

Returns:

Nested dict keyed by split (train, validation, test) with metric dictionaries; must include a macro section per split for aggregation logic used downstream.

Return type:

dict

abstract prepare_features(dataset)[source]

Convert dataset splits into backend-ready feature representations.

Parameters:

dataset (LoadedDataset) – Loaded dataset with train/validation/test splits and fingerprint columns.

Returns:

Tuple containing backend-ready feature arrays for train/val/test.

Return type:

tuple

abstract prepare_masks(Y_train, Y_val, Y_test)[source]

Build missing-target masks from targets for each split.

Parameters:

  • Y_train (numpy.ndarray) – Target arrays for each split with NaNs for missing values.

  • Y_val (numpy.ndarray) – Target arrays for each split with NaNs for missing values.

  • Y_test (numpy.ndarray) – Target arrays for each split with NaNs for missing values.

Returns:

Mask arrays with 1 for present targets and 0 for missing targets.

Return type:

tuple

abstract prepare_targets(dataset)[source]

Extract endpoint targets per split as numpy arrays.

Parameters:

dataset (LoadedDataset) – Dataset providing endpoint columns in each split.

Returns:

Numpy arrays for Y_train, Y_val, Y_test with NaNs for missing targets.

Return type:

tuple

abstract run(dataset, *, sample_weight_mapping=None, early_stopping_rounds=50, output_dir=None, extra_meta=None, dry_run=False)[source]

End-to-end training and evaluation on a single dataset.

Implements the canonical training flow: prepare_features -> prepare_targets -> prepare_masks -> build_model -> fit -> predict -> compute_metrics -> save_artifacts (if requested).

Parameters:

  • dataset (LoadedDataset) – The dataset used for training and evaluation.

  • sample_weight_mapping (dict or None) – Optional mapping for training sample weights.

  • early_stopping_rounds (int) – Early stopping parameter for the model.

  • output_dir (pathlib.Path or None) – Directory where artifacts will be saved; if none, artifacts are not written to disk.

  • extra_meta (dict, optional) – Any additional metadata to include with saved artifacts.

  • dry_run (bool)

Returns:

Nested metrics dictionary keyed by split; each split should expose at least a macro metrics dict.

Return type:

dict

abstract save_artifacts(model, metrics, output_dir, outputs, *, dataset, extra_meta=None)[source]

Persist model, metrics, and optional plots to disk.

Parameters:

  • model (BaseModel) – The trained model instance to persist.

  • metrics (dict) – Nested metrics as returned by compute_metrics().

  • output_dir (pathlib.Path) – Output directory to write artifacts under.

  • dataset (LoadedDataset) – Dataset used for generating plots and saving metadata.

  • extra_meta (dict, optional) – Additional metadata to store alongside metrics (will be merged with trainer‑specific info if desired).

  • outputs (RunOutputs)

Return type:

None

class admet.train.BaseRayMultiDatasetTrainer(*, trainer_cls, trainer_kwargs=None)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract Ray-based multi-dataset trainer.

This class encapsulates Ray orchestration for running a single-dataset trainer over many discovered dataset directories.

Parameters:

infer_metadata(hf_path, root)[source]

Default implementation that calls infer_split_metadata().

Backends may override this if they desire a different parsing heuristic.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Parameters:

  • hf_path (Path)

  • root (Path)

run_all(root, *, output_root=None, early_stopping_rounds=50, sample_weight_mapping=None, num_cpus=None, ray_address=None, seed=None, dry_run=False, max_duration_seconds=None, n_fingerprint_bits=None)[source]

Default Ray orchestration for all datasets discovered under root.

This method schedules a remote training job for each dataset using the generic _train_single_dataset_remote helper and aggregates results.

Return type:

Dict[str, Dict[str, object]]

Parameters:

  • root (Path)

  • output_root (Path | None)

  • early_stopping_rounds (int)

  • sample_weight_mapping (Dict[str, float] | None)

  • num_cpus (int | None)

  • ray_address (str | None)

  • seed (int | None)

  • dry_run (bool)

  • max_duration_seconds (float | None)

  • n_fingerprint_bits (int | None)

class admet.train.XGBoostRayMultiDatasetTrainer(*, trainer_cls, trainer_kwargs=None)[source]

Bases: BaseRayMultiDatasetTrainer

Multi-dataset trainer using Ray for XGBoost runs.

This class implements the small set of dataset-discovery and output path formation hooks required by BaseRayMultiDatasetTrainer. The actual Ray orchestration and scheduling is implemented by the base class method BaseRayMultiDatasetTrainer.run_all() which calls the generic remote helper for each dataset.

Parameters:

  • trainer_cls (Type[BaseModelTrainer])

  • trainer_kwargs (Optional[Dict[str, Any]])

build_output_dir(base, meta)[source]

Compose an output directory path from base and metadata.

Return type:

Path

Parameters:

  • base (Path)

  • meta (Dict[str, object])

discover_datasets(root)[source]

Return a sequence of dataset directories to train on.

Return type:

List[Path]

Parameters:

root (Path)

infer_metadata(hf_path, root)[source]

Default implementation that calls infer_split_metadata().

Backends may override this if they desire a different parsing heuristic.

Return type:

Dict[str, object]

Parameters:

  • hf_path (Path)

  • root (Path)

class admet.train.XGBoostTrainer(model_cls, *, model_params=None, seed=None, n_fingerprint_bits=None, device=None, mixed_precision=False)[source]

Bases: BaseModelTrainer

Single-dataset trainer implementation using XGBoost.

This class implements BaseModelTrainer for XGBoost backend models, delegates per-endpoint training to admet.model.xgb_wrapper.XGBoostMultiEndpoint, and preserves existing metrics and artifact formats used by the higher-level orchestration logic.

Notes

The class uses dataset fingerprints as features extracted from admet.data.load.LoadedDataset and predicts all endpoints using independent XGBoost regressors per endpoint.

Parameters:

  • model_cls (Type[ModelProtocol])

  • model_params (Optional[Dict[str, Any]])

  • seed (Optional[int])

  • n_fingerprint_bits (Optional[int])

  • device (Optional[str])

  • mixed_precision (bool)

build_model(endpoints)[source]

Build and return an XGBoostMultiEndpoint instance.

Parameters:

endpoints (list of str) – The endpoint names to predict.

Returns:

Backend model instance configured with self.model_params.

Return type:

XGBoostMultiEndpoint

build_sample_weights(dataset, sample_weight_mapping)[source]

Create a per-row sample-weight vector for the training split.

This function maps the dataset’s Dataset column values through sample_weight_mapping (with optional default key). When not supplied, returns None.

Return type:

Optional[ndarray]

Parameters:

  • dataset (LoadedDataset)

  • sample_weight_mapping (Dict[str, float] | None)

compute_metrics(Y_train, Y_val, Y_test, pred_train, pred_val, pred_test, mask_train, mask_val, mask_test, endpoints)[source]

Compute macro and per-endpoint metrics for all splits.

Parameters:

  • Y_train (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • Y_val (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • Y_test (numpy.ndarray) – True target arrays for each split.

  • pred_train (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted arrays for each split.

  • pred_val (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted arrays for each split.

  • pred_test (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted arrays for each split.

  • mask_train (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating observed targets for each split.

  • mask_val (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating observed targets for each split.

  • mask_test (numpy.ndarray) – Masks indicating observed targets for each split.

  • endpoints (list of str) – Endpoint columns corresponding to the final axis of Y.

Returns:

Nested metrics dictionary keyed by split name.

Return type:

dict

prepare_features(dataset)[source]

Prepare fingerprint feature matrices for each split.

Parameters:

dataset (LoadedDataset) – A loaded HF dataset produced by admet.data.load.load_dataset().

Returns:

(X_train, X_val, X_test) arrays suitable for training.

Return type:

tuple

prepare_masks(Y_train, Y_val, Y_test)[source]

Construct per‑split missing‑target masks.

Parameters:

  • Y_train (numpy.ndarray) – Target matrices with NaN for missing labels.

  • Y_val (numpy.ndarray) – Target matrices with NaN for missing labels.

  • Y_test (numpy.ndarray) – Target matrices with NaN for missing labels.

Returns:

Boolean masks (train, validation, test) where True indicates presence of a label.

Return type:

tuple

prepare_targets(dataset)[source]

Extract endpoint target arrays for each split.

Parameters:

dataset (LoadedDataset) – Loaded dataset with endpoint columns.

Returns:

(Y_train, Y_val, Y_test) numpy arrays with NaNs for missing targets.

Return type:

tuple

run(dataset, *, sample_weight_mapping=None, early_stopping_rounds=50, output_dir=None, extra_meta=None, dry_run=False)[source]

Perform the complete train -> predict -> eval flow.

High-level orchestration that delegates to BaseModelTrainer.run(); documented here for convenience.

Return type:

Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]]]

Parameters:

  • dataset (LoadedDataset)

  • sample_weight_mapping (Dict[str, float] | None)

  • early_stopping_rounds (int)

  • output_dir (Path | None)

  • extra_meta (Dict[str, object] | None)

  • dry_run (bool)

save_artifacts(model, metrics, output_dir, outputs, *, dataset, extra_meta=None)[source]

Save model, metrics, and generated figures to output_dir.

Parameters:

  • model (BaseModel) – The already-trained model instance.

  • metrics (dict) – Nested metrics dictionary as returned by compute_metrics().

  • output_dir (pathlib.Path) – Directory to write artifacts under.

  • dataset (LoadedDataset) – The dataset used for training; required for plotting.

  • extra_meta (dict, optional) – Optional extra metadata written alongside metrics (currently not persisted directly; reserved for future extension).

  • outputs (RunOutputs)

Return type:

None

admet.train.train_xgb_models(dataset, model_params=None, early_stopping_rounds=50, sample_weight_mapping=None, output_dir=None, seed=None)[source]

Convenience wrapper to train a single HF dataset using XGBoost.

Parameters:

  • dataset (LoadedDataset) – The dataset to train on.

  • model_params (dict, optional) – Hyperparameters for the XGBoost backend. If None, default parameters are used.

  • early_stopping_rounds (int, optional) – Early stopping parameter forwarded to the model.

  • sample_weight_mapping (dict, optional) – Mapping of dataset names to sample weights.

  • output_dir (pathlib.Path, optional) – Path to write artifacts under.

  • seed (int, optional) – Seed for deterministic model fit.

Returns:

Nested metrics dictionary keyed by split name (train, validation, test).

Return type:

dict

admet.train.train_xgb_models_ray(root, *, model_params=None, early_stopping_rounds=50, sample_weight_mapping=None, output_root=None, seed=None, n_fingerprint_bits=None, num_cpus=None, ray_address=None, dry_run=False, max_duration_seconds=None)[source]

Train XGBoost models in parallel via Ray across multiple HF datasets.

Parameters:

  • root (pathlib.Path) – Root directory to search for hf_dataset directories.

  • model_params (dict, optional) – Hyperparameter dictionary forwarded to the underlying model.

  • early_stopping_rounds (int, optional) – Early stopping value per run.

  • sample_weight_mapping (dict, optional) – Sample weights mapping for each dataset.

  • output_root (pathlib.Path, optional) – Root directory where per-dataset artifacts are written.

  • seed (int, optional) – Base seed for deterministic per-dataset seeds.

  • num_cpus (int, optional) – Number of CPUs to use when starting a local Ray instance.

  • ray_address (str, optional) – Optional Ray address to connect to; if 'local', a local Ray instance is started if not already running.

  • n_fingerprint_bits (int | None)

  • dry_run (bool)

  • max_duration_seconds (float | None)

Returns:

Mapping of dataset relative key to payload dict containing metrics, metadata, status, and timing fields.

Return type:

dict
